sen.j: 寄せ鍋（よせなべ）は、鍋料理の一つ。
sen.e: Yosenabe is a one-pot dish.
Yosenabe is a one-pot dish.
Yosenabe is a one-pot dish.

sen.j: 汁を入れた鍋に野菜や魚介類など様々な材料を入れて煮込むもの。
sen.e: Various ingredients such as vegetables and seafood are cooked together in a pot of broth.
Various ingredients such as vegetables and seafood are cooked together in a pot of broth.
Various ingredients such as vegetables and seafood are cooked together in a pot of broth.

sen.j: 地方毎に出汁や具材が異なり、多様な種類が存在する。
sen.e: There are wide varieties of Yosenabe, whose dashi broth and ingredients vary in each region.
There are wide varieties of Yosenabe, whose dashi broth and ingredients vary in each region.
There are wide varieties of Yosenabe, whose dashi broth and ingredients vary in each region.

sen.j: その地方の産物が入り特色が出る。
sen.e: Local specialities are added to characterize Yosenabe.
Local specialities are added to characterize Yosenabe.
Local specialities are added to characterize Yosenabe.

sen.j: 出汁はかつお、コンブ、キノコ、貝類などでとる。
sen.e: The stock is prepared from dried bonito, tangle, mushrooms, or shellfish.
The stock is prepared from dried bonito, tangle, mushrooms, or shellfish.
The stock is prepared from dried bonito, tangle, mushrooms, or shellfish.

sen.j: 味付けとしては、塩、醤油、酒、味噌（赤出し、白みそ）などが一般的。
sen.e: It is usually flavored with salt, soy sauce, sake, or miso (reddish-brown miso or white miso).
It is usually seasoned with salt, soy sauce, sake, or miso (reddish-brown miso or white miso).
sen.cmt: flavoredよりseasonedの方が適切だと思います。
sen.e: It is usually seasoned with salt, soy sauce, sake, or miso (reddish-brown miso or white miso).

sen.j: 具材は、白菜や葱などの野菜類、大豆製品（厚揚げ、焼き豆腐、油揚げ）、練り物類（はんぺん、ちくわ）、エビや魚、貝などの魚介類、肉類（牛、鳥、豚）、キノコ類など、ほとんど何でもアリといってよい。
sen.e: Varieties of ingredients, or almost anything else, are cooked in Yosenabe: vegetables such as Chinese cabbage and Welsh onion; processed-soybean products (thick deep-fried bean curd, toasted bean curd, deep-fried bean curd); fish-paste products (hanpen [a cake of ground fish combined with starch and steamed], chikuwa [fish sausage]); seafood such as prawn, fish, or shellfish; meat (beef, chicken, or pork); and mushrooms.

Varieties of ingredients, or almost anything else, are cooked in Yosenabe: vegetables such as Chinese cabbage and Welsh onion; processed-soybean products (atsuage [thick fried tofu], yakidofu (grilled tofu), abura-age [deep-fried tofu]); fish-paste products (hanpen [a cake of ground fish combined with starch and steamed], chikuwa [fish sausage]); seafood such as prawn, fish, or shellfish; meat (beef, chicken, or pork); and mushrooms.
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一しました。
sen.e: Varieties of ingredients, or almost anything else, are cooked in Yosenabe: vegetables such as Chinese cabbage and Welsh onion; processed-soybean products (atsuage [thick fried tofu], yakidofu (grilled tofu), abura-age [deep-fried tofu]); fish-paste products (hanpen [a cake of ground fish combined with starch and steamed], chikuwa [fish sausage]); seafood such as prawn, fish, or shellfish; meat (beef, chicken, or pork); and mushrooms.

sen.j: 鍋の種類によっては、最後に麺類（うどん、ラーメン）あるいはご飯類を入れて締めとすることが定番になっている。
sen.e: To finish it with noddles (Japanese wheat noodles and Chinese noodles) or rice is a standard procedure for some Yosenabe.
To finish it with noddles (Japanese wheat noodles and Chinese noodles) or rice is a standard procedure for some Yosenabe.
To finish it with noddles (Japanese wheat noodles and Chinese noodles) or rice is a standard procedure for some Yosenabe.
